reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed at the Looking Glass for our anniversary at the end of October. We booked less than a week out and had never stayed there before. We had the one bedroom unit. When we entered the room- which is really three rooms- a full bath, bedroom and livingroom with full kitchen- I thought they gave us the wrong room. It was far bigger than I had expected and was a very good value for what we paid. The veiw was beautiful and the entire unit was cleaned very well. We will certainly return without hesitation.
reviews.title: Very Pleased

likes.liked: — Veiw and beach outside the door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trip Advisor reviews are correct again and it’s no surprise the Looking Glass Inn is #1! We stayed just one night during our drive up the Oregon coast during August, but wished we could have stayed longer. The Inn is located overlooking the ocean, with a beautiful wide open view and a great beach for the kids to play. Several good restaurants are within walking distance. The rooms are exceptionally clean, comfortably furnished and equipped with lots of nice little touches. The manager, Mary Ann McGill, made us feel welcome and answered all our questions about the area, good restaurants, etc. This hotel has everything we look for and we are happy to recommend it.
reviews.title: Looking Glass Inn is the Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Best room for the buck.

reviews.text: My husband and I took a winter trip there last February and are returning in Sept for a few days. I checked it out on line and thought $99 for a jacuzzi suite there had to be something wrong. I was plesently surprised. I have stayed in nicer rooms but at more than triple the cost of this one. (Granted it was February so prices were at the lowest they were gonna go and it was FREEZING outside.) We stayed on the top floor and although the staight ocean view wasn't right in your face like at you'd see from Spanish Head you could see the surf off in the distance. You did have a great view of the bay and the sealions. My husband got up real early one morning to jog the beach and there were a few babies up on the shore on this side of the bay. Nothing was better after a chilly walk then coming into that room turning on the fireplace and jumping in that tub. Part of the reason we are waiting till Sept to go back. I don't think you get the full effect in July when it's much warmer.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel in Lincoln City

likes.liked: — big room, very clean, nice view

reviews.text: The hotel was real quite and the staff was friendly. I liked that there was a balcony and I sat out there with my morning coffee watching the sunrise. This hotel doesn't have a pool, hot tub or exersice equipment. It does have a nice little lobby with a continental type breakfast. I would only suggest staying here if you get one of the jacuzzi suites because for a regular room or suite there are better deals to be had in hotels with better views and more amenities down the beach. I really enjoyed my last visit and as long as the price stays that low I'll keep coming back.
reviews.title: Looking Glass is wonderful

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here in March on a road trip to San Fran from Vancouver. We found the Inn on the Internet before leaving - and made it a destination point. When we actually arrived, I wasn't impressed. None of the rooms are physically oceanside. A few offer some views - but most views are of parking lots with an ocean in the background. The hotel seems to be of cheap wood construction. Some generators (as I found out in the morning) mounted to the outside of our end unit kept vibrating our suite the entire night. I couldn't sleep. We also heard the guests upstairs a little too clearly. Our suite was equipped with a jacuzzi tub, but the hot water ran out before it was filled - and the jets were dirty. What saved me from marking this hotel "terrible" is its breakfast. Included with each stay is a continental breakfast that is better than most.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.text: I was not impressed with this hotel. The staff was friendly and the continetal breakfast was nice, but the hotel was old and creaky. The room description said ocean view, but it was partial view at best. The beach was shared with a public access parking lot so it was kind of a zoo atmosphere. Again just average.
reviews.title: just average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at the Looking Glass Inn 3 times in the last 2 years. We enjoy this hotel because they are very dog-friendly. When you check in, they give you a basket of items for your dog including towels, sheets, food/water bowls and poop bags. The hotel is across the street from Mo's restaurant and also a short walk to the beach/Siletz Bay. The only advice I have is to stay in a room on the 2nd floor, otherwise you have a view of the parking lot :( and you'll want to keep your curtains closed most the time to keep people from looking into your room! Other than that, the prices are reasonable and the rooms seem to be updated & modern. Oh and their continental breakfast is awesome!!! Bagels, cream cheese, pastries, fruit, cereal, orange juice, muffins, etc. Much better than most hotels.
reviews.title: All dogs aboard!

likes.disliked: — Yucky view of the parking lot when staying on the 1st floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights during this holiday time and had a great time. This hotel is across the street from Mo's which worked out really great after traveling for a few hours, we didn't feel like getting back in the car later that night. It also is across the street from the bay and ocean. In the morning when we got up we could see seals across the bay and also floating around in the surf. That was really neat. The hotel itself is very clean. Although the breakfast area is a little small, they give you trays to take your breakfast back to your room. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. They are very pet-friendly and give your pets a basket with some sheets and towels and two bowls for food. We were very happy with the location and the service. We would definately come back here again.
reviews.title: Loved the Looking Glass Inn

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here for one night whilst touring BC, WA and OR. We had a two-bedroomed suite overlooking the ocean and it was excellent. It had a sofa bed in the living room and five of us stayed here comfortably. The kitchen is well appointed with a large cooker and fridge. There is also a microwave, toaster, etc. The staff are charming and a decent American style continental breakfast is served in the reception area. I would have loved to spend more time here. It is in a quiet, laid back area of Lincoln City, away from the tacky centre. MO's restaurant across the street from the Looking Glass Inn was pretty disappointing. There were long queues and although the location is excellent the food was greasy and mediocre. We did not have time to try anywhere else but suggest you jump in the car and try somewhere in Lincoln City.
reviews.title: If only there had been more time

likes.liked: — The size of the suites and the excellent kitchen facilities.
likes.disliked: — Apparent lack of good restaurants within walking distance.

reviews.title: We loved the Looking Glass Inn!
reviews.text: We have just returned from four days at the Looking Glass Inn in Lincoln City ... and we can't wait to go back! It was wonderful - people and pet friendly, a great staff, nicely appointed interiors, super clean and very resonable in cost. We were on the second level, in the front corner - over looking both the ocean and the bay . From our suite we could see a seal colony, folks crabbing and fishing and generally enjoying life at the beach, It was sooo interesting. Everytime my husband went beach combing from the Inn, he returned with a pocket full of agates! The beach is very close to and on a level with the Inn.

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!
reviews.text: We also enjoyed the yummy breakfast (included), free newspaper and afternoon coffee and cookies. If you have a dog, they provide a darling basket with sheets, a towel, artfully arranged potty bags, two custom bowls and a funny letter from their dog to yours.
We learned of Looking Glass Inn from TripAdvisor. Thank you T.A. We can't wait to return.
reviews.title: What a great hideaway
